meanings.definition: A band of thickened tissue serving to hold an organ or part in place.
meanings.sent1: The retinaculum kept the tendon in place during the movement.
meanings.sent2: The doctor used a retinaculum to secure the muscle in its proper position.
meanings.sent3: The retinaculum was like a trusty guard, ensuring the organ stayed where it belonged.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted as a retinaculum, anchoring her focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The retinaculum was a sturdy belt, cinching the organ securely in its spot.

meanings.definition: A small ligament or band of fibrous tissue.
meanings.sent1: The retinaculum connected the bones, providing stability to the joint.
meanings.sent2: He felt a twinge in his retinaculum as he stretched his arm.
meanings.sent3: The retinaculum was like a tiny bridge, linking the two ends together.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a retinaculum, holding their fragile relationship intact.
meanings.sent5: The retinaculum was a delicate thread, keeping the structure from falling apart.
